author: R Sivaraman
text:
Hunorine was lying in a pool of blood in the drawing room

A 68-year-old woman, a Puducherry-origin French national, was murdered by an unknown person at her residence in prime area of the city.

Police identified the victim as Hunorine (68). Police said the woman was living in Puducherry after she was estranged from her husband twenty years ago.

Her two adopted children were staying in France while she was living with her eight-year-old grand-daughter at a rented house in Akkasamy Koil Street, Chinnayapuram.

According to police sources, after the housemaid left for her home last night, she was chatting with a relative in the drawing room and watching television and asked her grand-daughter to go to sleep. Around 3.30 a.m, the child woke up and found that her grand mother was not by her side. She came to the hall and found Ms. Hunorine in a pool of blood and her face mutilated.

The shocked child managed to telephone the maid. The maid in turn alerted neighbours and the relatives of the deceased. Muthialpet Police registered the case against unknown persons for offences under Section 302(Murder) of Indian Penal Code. Police recovered the body and sent it for post mortem. The police lifted fingerprints from the house.

V. Deivasigamani, Superintendent of Police (East) told The Hindu , “There was no disturbance to any of material objects inside the house and all her attire was intact. No valuables were stolen from the house. We are investigating the case from different angles.”

title: French national found murdered
